revised_title: Anatomical Observations on the Round Worm Bred in Human Bodies
tldr: The author, Edward Tyson, examines the anatomy of the Lumbricus teres, a round worm commonly found in human bodies. He provides detailed descriptions of the worm's reproductive organs and compares them to those of earthworms, highlighting the differences and similarities. Tyson also discusses the worm's motion and the role of a fluid called ichor in their anatomy.
